Articles.Content: Get one object in a Kerbol orbit that does not cross Kerbin\'s orbit, and get another object out there to touch it 8)

that was my first ever solar orbit!

I tried to land on the mun, but got sorta launched out into deep space in an orbit that didn\'t cross kerbol\'s path.

I don\'t think this is possible, the distances are far too vast and by the time you got another rocket out there to attempt an intercept, the other piece would be far gone. There\'s almost no way you could calculate a perfect intercept trajectory on the first pass and would likely orbit Kerbol for hours(at 10k warp) until you even got close, let alone intercept it.
I\'ve thought about this, but decided not to try it because it would take a LONG time. But if anyone manages to do this, +1.
I got one thing into Kerbol orbit but it took so long that I don\'t even want to try and intercept it.
